comment: A move that usually leads to closed positions.
The opening is now a Queen's Gambit Declined by transposition of moves. This position could have arisen from 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7
comment: Not 3... Nc6 blocking the c pawn.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6
comment: Defending the pawn on d5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5
comment: Pinning the knight and therefore threatening the pawn on d5. The usual move for Black here is 5... Be7 breaking the pin.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4
comment: This is an aggressive way to protect the pawn.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3
comment: White is developing normally.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5
comment: Putting some presure on White's center.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4
comment: Although this move gains space on the queenside, it takes pressure off the center. White now strives to play e4.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O
comment: The rook will go to e1 to support the pawn move to e4.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1
comment: White now threatens 14. e4 dxe4 15. Bxe4 with an overwhelming position. The pin of the knight prevents 15... Nxe4.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6
comment: Breaking the pin. Note that White has developed all his pieces except the rook on a1; Black hasn't developed either rook or the queen's bishop.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2
comment: The point is to play 15. e4.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4
comment: Stopping 16. e4. White now turns his attention to Black's weak pawns.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4
comment: Black has successfully prevented e4, but at a cost. White is ahead in development and Black is left with weak queenside pawns that White can use his advantave in development to attack.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4
comment: Threatening 18. axb5 and Black cannot play 18... axb5 because of 19. Qxa8. If Black plays 17... bxa4 then his pawn formation is shattered.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5
comment: This looks like a saving move since it gains time by attacking the bishop. After 18. Bf4 Black can play 18... Bb7 guarding the rook on a8 so that 19. axb5 could be answered with 19... axb5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5
comment: When you are ahead in development, you must strike before your opponent has time to mobilize. Black cannot play 18... axb5 because of 19. Qxa1.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4
comment: If now 19... Ra7 then 20. b6 $1 Qxa5 21. bxa7 $1 Bb7 22. Rxa5 Bxe4 23. Rxa6 with a winning position.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4 Rb8 20. bxa6
comment: White has enormous compensation for the knight including a threatening passed pawn on a6, a lead in development, and very actively placed pieces. Black cannot hold on for long. If 21... Qxa5 then 22. Rxa5 and the threat of 23. a7 cannot be stopped.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4 Rb8 20. bxa6 Rb5 21. Qc7
comment: The threat is 22. a7 and 23 a8=Q.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4 Rb8 20. bxa6 Rb5 21. Qc7 Nb6 22. a7 Bh3
comment: The pawn on g2 cannot capture the bishop because it is pinned. This move indirectly reduces the bishop on e4's support of the a pawn's advance since the biship is needed to prevent ... Qxg2#.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4 Rb8 20. bxa6 Rb5 21. Qc7 Nb6 22. a7 Bh3 23. Reb1 Rxb1+ 24. Rxb1
comment: If 24... Na4 then 25. Rg8 wins immediately.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4 Rb8 20. bxa6 Rb5 21. Qc7 Nb6 22. a7 Bh3 23. Reb1 Rxb1+ 24. Rxb1 f5 25. Bf3 f4
comment: Desperation.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 Nd7 4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. cxd5 exd5 7. Qa4 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. e3 c5 10. Bd3 c4 11. Bc2 Qe7 12. O-O a6 13. Rfe1 Qe6 14. Nd2 b5 15. Qa5 Ne4 16. Nxe4 dxe4 17. a4 Qd5 18. axb5 Qxg5 19. Bxe4 Rb8 20. bxa6 Rb5 21. Qc7 Nb6 22. a7 Bh3 23. Reb1 Rxb1+ 24. Rxb1 f5 25. Bf3 f4 26. exf4
comment: Black resigned. If 26... Qxf4 27. Qxf4 Rxf4 28. Rxb6.
